description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: Directives concernant le processus mis en place au titre de l’aide ciblée aux pays dans le cadre du PEF

description.narrative: A travers le cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires, les partenaires de l’Alliance du Vaccin soutiennent les activités de vaccination au niveau national
Gavi’s targeted country assistance aims to share our partners’ specialist skills with the countries we support

title.narrative: À propos de l’aide ciblée aux pays

description.narrative: L’aide ciblée aux pays de Gavi vise à partager les compétences spécialisées de nos partenaires avec les pays que nous soutenons
Through the partners’ engagement framework, Vaccine Alliance partners support countries’ immunisation activities

condition.narrative: Conditions are detailed in the Partners’ engagement framework
Les conditions sont détaillées dans le cadre d'engagement des partenaires

title.narrative: New specific VPD surveillance system implemented or integrated

target.value: Monitor the performance of VPDs surveillance system at district level

comment.narrative: Integrated supportive supervision (ISS) on VPDs surveillance was conducted in 29 district hospitals, and 103 health centers. Sensitization and refresher of 406 health care providers on VPDs case definitions and surveillance indicators was completed. Surveillance data entered in the data management system, cleaned and analyzed on monthly basis; and feedback was provided to district for action. Organized and facilitated VPDs surveillance related meetings and workshops at national and subnational levels. Built capacity of district hospital EPI and surveillance focal points on ISS and ODK for data collection. In total 42 district focal points were trained.

title.narrative: -75 % of districts have developed standardized microplanning -First evaluation review meeting conducted

target.value: 1. Support EPI to address gaps in REC microplanning and implementation in the context of reaching the under-immunized and unimmunized children (dissemination of REC guide and tools). 2. Support EPI to conduct bi-annual review of routine immunization and VPDs surveillance performance at provincial level

comment.narrative: Activity rescheduled

title.narrative: -100% of district developed and implement standardized Microplans -Second performance review meeting conducted

target.value: 1. Support EPI to address gaps in REC microplanning and implementation in the context of reaching the under-immunized and unimmunized children (dissemination of REC guide and tools). 2. Support EPI to conduct bi-annual review of routine immunization and VPDs surveillance performance at provincial level

comment.narrative: REC guide and REC tools were developed and are awaiting for approval and dissemination. The activities planned included the workshops, meeting and travels for field mission to supervise the implementation of REC. The implementation was hampered by the occurrence of COVID-19 and measures put in place to control the outbreak including lockdowns, mass gathering and travel restrictions. The activities will be implemented in Q3, 2021

comment.narrative: REC guide and REC tools were developed and are awaiting for approval and dissemination. target.value: 1. Support EPI to conduct operational research that will identify root causes of low and substandard coverage rates (> 100%) in priority districts and develop action plan to address challenges.

comment.narrative: TThe activity was planned to identify root causes for low and substandard coverage in selected districts. However, the occurrence of COVID-19 delayed the implementation and affected the quality of immunization data that can be addressed by a deep assessment to understand the effects of COVID-19 on the immunization system delivery. This activity is not expected to be implemented within the remaining period.

target.value: 1. Support EPI to conduct operational research that will identify root causes of low and substandard coverage rates (> 100%) in priority districts and develop action plan to address challenges.

comment.narrative: This activity was not implemented. Instead, an overall assessment of effect of COVID-19 on immunization delivery system is ongoing and will be completed by Dec 2021

title.narrative: 1. Operational research completed and plan of action available

target.value: 1. Support EPI to conduct operational research that will identify root causes of low and substandard coverage rates (> 100%) in priority districts and develop action plan to address challenges.

comment.narrative: The implementation of the operational research is challenging due to the changes caused by the COVID-19 in immunization coverage data and the current situation of the COVID-19 outbreak with movement restrictions to control the outbreak. The activity need to be revised to take into consideration the COVID-19 context. Given the remaining time, the activity is not expected to be implemented

title.narrative: -100% of district developed and implement standardized Microplans -Second performance review meeting conducted

target.value: 1. Support EPI to address gaps in REC microplanning and implementation in the context of reaching the under-immunized and unimmunized children (dissemination of REC guide and tools). 2. Support EPI to conduct bi-annual review of routine immunization and VPDs surveillance performance at provincial level

comment.narrative: The review of immunization coverage by district and health center was conducted. District analyzed their immunization coverage data and gaps related to reporting, vaccination coverage, data quality, low coverage in health centers were identified. With the support of central level, district hospital developed action plans to address the gaps, and the national level will ensure follow up of the implementation. The microplanning sessions were not conducted as results of COVID-19 impact on the implementation of routine activities. The microplanning sessions have been scheduled to Q1 2022

title.narrative: EVM implementation plan is on track

target.value: Support immunization services strenthening, the NILWG operationalization, evidences generation, supply chain strengthening and demand generation.

comment.narrative: Activity on good track: NILWG is operational, KAPB and CEA completed, System design under implementation and SBCC strategy is under development.

title.narrative: Systems in place to track vaccine stocks at all levels and corrective measures undertaken

target.value: Support immunization services strenthening, the NILWG operationalization, evidences generation, supply chain strengthening and demand generation.

comment.narrative: The NILWG is operational, the main role is to monitor the implementation of the EVMIP implementation. During this reporting period the system design phase 2 - concerning distribution of vaccines for 3 months stock to DH-is being implemented through PUSH system. The NILWG is much involved in Covid-19 vaccines logistics and distribution including development of SOPs and specific vaccines guidelines. For supply Strengthening, funds were mobilized to procure additional CCEs to fill the gap where the CCEOP did not cover especially for replacement of unfunctional and obsolete CCEs, procurement is ongoing using UNICEF own funds. The demand generation activities ongoing, for the immunization communication strategy the consultant is working on the comments from CO and RO and for IECs materials the institutional consultant is working on draft posters and scripts.

comment.narrative: Measles elimination operational plan was drafted but not implemented due to current COVID-19 outbreak and response activities

title.narrative: Technical support from IST ESA identified and request submitted

target.value: Support ESR to revitalize Congenital Rubella Syndrome (CRS) Surveillance including the development of CRS related guiding documents, establishment of Surveillance sentinel sites and building capacity of HCP on the CRS surveillance

comment.narrative: The activity was discussed with IST ESA and re-programmed to start with retrospective review of CRS cases in referral hospital and health facility assessment for the establishment of sentinel site

title.narrative: The consultant to support the operational research is hired Plan of review meetings developed

target.value: 1. Support EPI to conduct operational research that will identify root causes of low and substandard coverage rates (> 100%) in priority districts and develop action plan to address challenges.

comment.narrative: The implementation of the operational research is challenging due to the changes caused by the COVID-19 in immunization coverage data and the current situation of the COVID-19 outbreak with movement restrictions to control the outbreak. The activity need to be revised to take into consideration the COVID-19 context. Given the remaining time, the activity is not expected to be implemented.

title.narrative: REC assessment completed and Bottlenecks identified and action plan to address the gaps developed - quarterly reports demonstrating impact to be shared with Gavi when reporting 6-monthly on milestones

target.value: Support the EPI to evaluate the implementation of REC

comment.narrative: This activity delayed as the implementation coincided with the preparation of COVID-19 vaccine introduction. All the staff involved were repurposed to support the COVID-19 vaccination

title.narrative: Desk review and measles situation analysis completed

target.value: Support RBC/ESR to produce measles and Rubella elimination strategic plan (5 years), revise and disseminate surveillance technical documents

comment.narrative: This activity has been rescheduled

target.value: Provide technical support for the development of AEFI crisis management plan

title.narrative: REC evaluation results disseminated Plan of action developed for REC microplanning develpment elaborated Plan of review meetings developed

target.value: 1. Support EPI to address gaps in REC microplanning and implementation in the context of reaching the under-immunized and unimmunized children (dissemination of REC guide and tools). 2. Support EPI to conduct bi-annual review of routine immunization and VPDs surveillance performance at provincial level
Support planning, configuration and management of COVID-19 surveillance

title.narrative: Immunisation registry digital package configured and installed

target.value: Support planning, configuration and management of immunisation registries

title.narrative: Core team trained on COVID-19 digital data package and know how to use it.

target.value: Support planning, configuration and management of COVID-19 surveillance

title.narrative: Immunisation registry piloted in one district. Costed scale up plan exist

target.value: Support planning, configuration and management of immunisation registries
